claim: If alternate-reality versions of characters were merged with their primary counterparts before computing the mean, the resulting average attribute value for neutral-aligned superheroes would be lower.
extra_info: average = AVG(attribute_value); neutral superheroes refers to alignment_id = 3;
reasoning: This is a counterfactual claim describing a hypothetical scenario ('If alternate-reality versions of characters were merged...'). The database records actual data, not what would happen under imagined transformations. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from a database and must be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO.

content.text:
This claim describes a hypothetical "what if" scenario: "If alternate-reality versions of characters were merged with their primary counterparts before computing the mean..." This is a counterfactual claim — it asks what would happen under an imagined data transformation that didn't actually occur.

According to my instructions, counterfactual claims that describe hypothetical scenarios ("If X had happened...", "If X were changed...") cannot be verified from a database that only records what actually happened. These must always be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO.

The database records actual data, not what would happen under imagined transformations. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from a database and must be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO."}
